name: lume
description: Create and manage Apple Silicon-native virtual machines

repo.name: cua
repo.description: Open-source infrastructure for Computer-Use Agents. Sandboxes, SDKs, and benchmarks to train and evaluate AI agents that can control full desktops (macOS, Linux, Windows).

readme.summary: Well-structured README with clear installation and quick start for three distinct products, but lacks configuration details and troubleshooting guidance in the main document.
readme.top_issue: No troubleshooting section in main README; users must navigate to external docs for common issues or error handling

injection_risks.description: Potential command injection vulnerability in 'run_command' function, which executes shell commands with user input.
Potential SQL string concatenation vulnerability in database queries, although no explicit database interactions are found in the provided code.

critical_findings: Lack of input validation for sensitive data
security.summary: The code has several security concerns, including potential command injection vulnerabilities and lack of input validation, which need to be addressed to ensure the security and integrity of the system.

common_complaints: macOS VM rendering issues with application windows not displaying
Discrepancies between documentation and actual NPM releases
Screenshot coordinate translation problems with MCP tools
VNC server conflicts and inability to disable it
sentiment.summary: Lume has active engagement with developers reporting technical issues, but several blocking bugs around macOS VM rendering and documentation gaps are creating friction and frustration in the community.

communication.summary: Maintainer responses are generally clear and helpful, though could be more detailed in some cases.

concerns: No commits in past 6 months despite last commit being recent (2026-01-27)
107 open issues with no recent activity
Zero closed issues in past 6 months
No merged PRs in past 6 months
No active contributors in past 6 months
positive_signals: Repository still exists and has recent commit history
maintenance.summary: The lume package appears abandoned with no maintenance activity in the past 6 months despite having a large backlog of 107 open issues.

governance.summary: The documentation lacks a succession plan and contributor ladder, indicating high bus factor risk.

project_metrics.description: Open-source infrastructure for Computer-Use Agents. Sandboxes, SDKs, and benchmarks to train and evaluate AI agents that can control full desktops (macOS, Linux, Windows).

analysis_summary.doc_summary: The documentation is generally well-structured and provides a good overview of the package's capabilities, but lacks clear installation instructions and troubleshooting guidance.
concerns: Docs: Lack of troubleshooting section and unclear installation instructions for the lume package specifically
Community: environment variable not passed to Windows VM
Community: overlay support missing for container
Governance: High bus factor risk identified
Security: Lack of input validation for sensitive data
Security: Potential command injection vulnerability in 'run_command' function, which executes shell commands with user input.
highlights: High number of commits in the past six months (1000)
A large number of merged PRs in the past six months (269)
Multiple contributors active in the past six months (22)
